body: could you provide the full stack trace of the error?

```
1. in ./vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/QueryBuilder.php at line 1544
2. in ./vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/QueryBuilder.php at line 1521 – yii\db\QueryBuilder::createConditionFromArray()
3. in ./vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/conditions/ConjunctionConditionBuilder.php at line 60 – yii\db\QueryBuilder::buildCondition()
4. in ./vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/conditions/ConjunctionConditionBuilder.php at line 35 – yii\db\conditions\ConjunctionConditionBuilder::buildExpressionsFrom()
5. in./vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/QueryBuilder.php at line 281 – yii\db\conditions\ConjunctionConditionBuilder::build()
6. in ./vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/QueryBuilder.php at line 1525 – yii\db\QueryBuilder::buildExpression()
7. in ./vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/oci/conditions/InConditionBuilder.php at line 69 – yii\db\QueryBuilder::buildCondition()
8. in ./vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/oci/conditions/InConditionBuilder.php at line 28 – yii\db\oci\conditions\InConditionBuilder::splitCondition()
9. in ./vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/QueryBuilder.php at line 281 – yii\db\oci\conditions\InConditionBuilder::build()
10. in ./vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/QueryBuilder.php at line 1525 – yii\db\QueryBuilder::buildExpression()

14. in ./vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/Query.php at line 237 – yii\db\ActiveQuery::createCommand()
15. in ./vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/ActiveQuery.php at line 133 – yii\db\Query::all()
16. in ./vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/ActiveRelationTrait.php at line 268 – yii\db\ActiveQuery::all()
17. in ./vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/ActiveQueryTrait.php at line 151 – yii\db\ActiveQuery::populateRelation()
18. in ./vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/ActiveQuery.php at line 212 – yii\db\ActiveQuery::findWith()
```

I assume that this test should be broken: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/ac687aab292088a1a3525f10930e7a1f0403173b/tests/framework/db/oci/QueryBuilderTest.php#L135

but we do not run oracle tests on travis so it seems thats why it was not noticed.

issue.title: blind fix for oracle InCondition builder

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
condition should be an array like `['OR', ['IN', 'col', [...]], ['IN', 'col', [...]], ...]` instead of `['OR', [  ['IN', 'col', [...]], ['IN', 'col', [...]]  ]]`

This should have already broken the test at https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/ac687aab292088a1a3525f10930e7a1f0403173b/tests/framework/db/oci/QueryBuilderTest.php#L135
but as we are not running oracle tests on travis it got unnoticed.

| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | yes
| New feature?  |no
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | **someone with an oracle environment should check this.**
| Fixed issues  | fixes #16073

body: After applying the patch, this error is gone.

issue.title: QueryBuilder fails when over 1000 records

labels.name: status:to be verified
labels.description: Needs to be reproduced and validated.

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
Hi

I am experiencing a similar issue to [this](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/16073) and also getting:

> strtoupper() expects parameter 1 to be string, object given


at line `yiisoft\yii2\db\QueryBuilder.php:1546`

I have the following query in:

```php
VtCol::find()
          ->alias('V')
          ->innerJoinWith('site')
          //->innerJoinWith('cardNumber') -> Causes Error
          //->joinWith('pat')  -> Causes Error
          ->where(['V.DEL_DT' => null])
          ->andWhere(['<=', new Expression("TRUNC(TO_DATE(V.PRO_DATE, 'YYYYMMDD'))"), new Expression("TRUNC(TO_DATE('" . $quarterEndDate . "', 'YYYYMMDD'))")])
          ->andWhere(['V.FLWP_IND' => null])
          ->andWhere(['V.PASS_FOR_PAY' => null])
          ->andWhere(['V.SIGNED' => 'Y']) 
          ->all();
```

One of my relations looks like this:

```php
public function getCardNumber()
    {
        return $this->hasOne(CardNumber::className(), ['PARTICIPANT_ID' => 'PARTICIPANT_ID_ID'])
                    ->andOnCondition(['CARD_NUMBER.CARD_TYPE_CD' => 35])
                    ->andOnCondition(['CARD_NUMBER.DEL_DT' => null]);
    }
```

I have spent some time tracing through this. I started by limiting the rows the query returned and it runs fine if below 1000 rows. I also ran the raw query in TOAD and the whole thing returns fine, it's only looking for 1400 rows to start with.

I have noticed that it returns the first 1000 rows ok, but when it comes to build the condition for the remaining 400 rows it drops the operator and just uses the condition Objects.

The first time it runs fine

![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6732997/50695141-3370d880-1012-11e9-8fb4-908f3c2b60de.PNG)

Expanding the $condition var:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6732997/50695364-cc9fef00-1012-11e9-8009-4a21aadf0901.png)


The second though, at some point there appears to be no initial operator and just the `yii\db\conditions\InCondition` object

![capture3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6732997/50695187-5b603c00-1012-11e9-8540-9be9e9c2d538.PNG)


### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Trying to load relations with over 1000 rows

### What is the expected result?
That the data returns with joined results
### What do you get instead?
> strtoupper() expects parameter 1 to be string, object given


### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.15.1
| PHP version      |  7.1.4
| Operating system | Windows XAMPP
